user_query: What's the current date and time?
Display a calendar for the current month.
What's my username?
Show me a list of files and directories in the current folder.
List all files including hidden ones.
List files with detailed information like permissions and size.

Display the content of the file 'note.txt'.

Remove the file 'new_note.txt'.

Check the memory usage of my system.
Show me a list of running processes.

Show me the manual for the 'ls' command.

Search for the word 'error' in the file 'log.txt'.
Count the number of lines, words, and characters in 'document.txt'.

Display the last 10 lines of 'big_file.log'.

Display the current working directory.
Clear the terminal screen.
Show my command history.
Print 'Hello, World!' to the terminal.
Display a list of users currently logged in.
Display a hierarchical view of the current directory.
Show the network configuration of my machine.
Test network connectivity to google.com.
Download a file from a URL, say 'https://example.com/file.zip'.
Display the current weather for a city, for example, London.
Create a zip archive of the directory 'my_project'.
Extract the contents of 'my_project.zip'.
Change the permissions of 'script.sh' to be executable.
View the permission settings for a file 'file.txt'.
Show me the uptime of my system.
List all installed packages on a Debian/Ubuntu system.
List all installed packages on a Fedora/CentOS system.
Find all instances of the file 'report.pdf' on my system.
Display the command I executed last.
Show the disk usage of the current directory.
List all network connections.
Watch system resource usage in real-time.
Count the number of lines in all '.py' files in the current directory.
Display the public IP address of my machine.
Search for a package 'python3' on an apt-based system.
Show the number of processes running for a specific user, e.g., 'ubuntu'.
Display the last 5 commands I ran.
Find all files larger than 10MB in the current directory.
Create a tar archive of 'my_folder' named 'my_folder.tar'.
Extract 'my_folder.tar'.
Create a compressed tar archive of 'my_folder' with gzip.
Extract a gzip compressed tar archive.
Check if a file exists, say 'file.txt'.
command: [ -f file.txt ] && echo 'File exists' || echo 'File does not exist'

user_query: Search for a specific process, for example, 'apache2'.
Find a list of all files in the current directory and its subdirectories.
Remove a directory named 'old_dir' and all its contents.
Compare two text files 'file1.txt' and 'file2.txt' and show the differences.
Sort the contents of 'data.txt' and save the sorted command to 'sorted_data.txt'.
Display the user ID and group ID of the current user.
Show all environment variables.
Create a symbolic link from 'original_file.txt' to 'link_to_file.txt'.
Show the routing table.
Run a command and send its command to a file 'command.txt' instead of the screen.
Append the command of a command to an existing file 'log.txt'.
Check the status of a specific service, say 'sshd'.
Display the architecture of the CPU.
Display the kernel version.
Show a list of all mounted filesystems.
Count the number of files in the current directory.
Change the group ownership of 'file.txt' to 'developers'.
Find and replace all occurrences of 'old_text' with 'new_text' in 'file.txt'.
Show the processes that are consuming the most memory.
Show the 10 most recently modified files in the current directory.
Display the size of 'my_folder' in a human-readable format.
Find all empty files in the current directory and its subdirectories.
Display the first 5 lines of all '.log' files in the current directory.
command: for file in *.log; do echo '--- $file ---'; head -n 5 $file; done

user_query: Send a text message to a user named 'john' with the message 'Hello, John!'.
Show the version of the current shell.
Watch the number of connected users every 2 seconds.
Display the last time a user logged in.
Count the number of subdirectories in the current directory.
Show the IP address of the website 'google.com'.
Display a list of processes filtered by the user 'root'.
Display the names of all files in the current directory, one per line.
List the files and directories and sort them by size.
Display the full path of the command 'python'.
Run a command in the background, for example, 'sleep 60'.
Display the job number of the last command run in the background.
Bring the last background job to the foreground.
Change the password for the current user.
Display a message every 5 seconds until manually stopped.
command: while true; do echo 'Hello'; sleep 5; done

user_query: Check if a specific port, e.g., 80, is open on the system.
Display a list of all users on the system.
Remove all '.log' files in the current directory.
Create a file named 'large_file' with a size of 100MB.
Find all files that were modified in the last 24 hours.
Find all files that were accessed more than 30 days ago.
Display a list of the 10 most-used commands from my history.
command: history | sed 's/\s*[0-9]*\s*//' | sort | uniq -c | sort -nr | head -n 10

user_query: Show me a visual representation of running processes as a tree.
Count the number of files and directories in the current directory.
Display the first column of a CSV file 'data.csv'.
Show the available shell interpreters.

Convert all characters in 'file.txt' to uppercase and save to 'uppercase.txt'.
Display a list of all listening network sockets.
Check if a file is a directory, for example, 'my_folder'.
command: if [ -d 'my_folder' ]; then echo 'It is a directory'; fi

user_query: Display the first unique lines of a file 'data.txt'.
Display the first 5 unique lines of 'data.txt'.
Get a random number between 1 and 100.
Search for all '.conf' files and display their path.
Display the 5 most recently created directories in the current directory.
Display the total size of all '.jpg' files in the current directory.
Change all spaces in file names to underscores in the current directory.
command: for f in *\ *; do mv "$f" "${f// /_}"; done

user_query: Find and display the 5 largest files in the current directory.
Calculate the sum of all numbers in a file 'numbers.txt', one number per line.
Split a file 'big_file.txt' into smaller chunks of 1000 lines each.
Merge all '.part' files into a single file 'merged_file.txt'.
Display the top 10 most common words in 'document.txt'.
command: tr -s ' ' '\n' < document.txt | sort | uniq -c | sort -nr | head -n 10

EOF

Find all files with the '.jpg' extension and move them to a new directory 'photos'.
Display the IP address of 'google.com' using the 'dig' command.
Show the disk usage of the system's root directory.
Find and list all files in the current directory that are not regular files.
Display a list of all system services and their status.
Count the number of files with the '.txt' extension in the current directory and its subdirectories.
Show the total size of all files in the current directory.
Display the manual page for the 'grep' command.
Find all files with the '.log' extension and display their size and permissions.
Display a list of all available commands in the current shell that are functions.
Show the version of the 'bash' shell.
Find and list all files in the current directory that are regular files.
Display the calendar for the month of October 2025.
Show the number of processes running for a specific user, 'ubuntu'.
Count the number of symbolic links in the current directory.
Find all files with the '.conf' extension and display their content in a single command.
Display the first 5 lines of a file 'large_file.log'.
Show the total size of all files with the '.txt' extension.
Find all files with the '.sh' extension and make them executable.
Display a list of all open network ports.
Show the 10 most recently used commands from the history.
Find all files in the current directory that are not symbolic links.
Count the number of files and directories in the current directory.
Display the manual page for the 'find' command.
Show a list of all available commands in the user's PATH.
Find all files with the '.jpg' extension and display their size in kilobytes.
Display the IP address of 'example.com' using the 'host' command.
Show the current date and time in a specific format: Month Day, Year.
Find all files in the current directory that are not empty.
Count the number of lines in all '.py' files in the current directory.
Display a list of all mounted filesystems and their free space.
Show the total size of all '.pdf' files in the current directory.
Find all files with the '.conf' extension and display their ownership.
Display the manual page for the 'touch' command.
Show a list of all processes that have open network connections to a specific port, e.g., 80.
Count the number of files in the current directory and its subdirectories that are regular files.
Show the 10 most recently modified files in the 'Documents' directory.
Find all files in the current directory that are not executable and display their names.
Display the calendar for the month of June 2025.
Show the total size of all files with the '.sh' extension.
Find all files with the '.txt' extension and display their size and permissions.
Count the number of files and directories in the current directory, including hidden ones.
Display the manual page for the 'du' command.
Show a list of all running processes and their full command line arguments.
Find all files with the '.log' extension and display the first 5 lines of each.
command: for file in *.log; do echo '--- $file ---'; head -n 5 $file; done
